common.title: Switch-to.eu
common.description: A guide to help you switch from non-EU to EU-based digital services and products.
common.subtitle: EU alternatives to global services
common.tryDifferentSearch: Try a different search term or browse our categories

common.searchDefaultText: Find a non-EU service to replace

home.heading: Moving away from big tech? Make the switch.
home.subheading: Find EU alternatives to global services and protect your data under EU law
home.heroTitle: Moving away from big tech? Make the switch!
home.heroSubtitle: Are you concerned about your privacy and the power abuse by American tech companies? This website helps you switch to European and open-source alternatives.
home.heroDescription: Tell us which digital service you want to change and we'll help you with the transition!
home.featuresEuropeanDescription: Discover a curated collection of EU-based digital services that respect your privacy and align with European values. Each alternative is thoroughly evaluated for functionality, reliability, and compliance with EU regulations.
home.featuresGuidesDescription: Follow our clear, detailed migration instructions to seamlessly transition from global services to European alternatives. Our guides break down complex processes into manageable steps anyone can follow.
home.featuresCommunityDescription: Our platform thrives on user participation. Anyone can contribute by adding new services, creating or improving migration guides, and sharing their experiences. This collaborative approach ensures our content stays relevant, accurate, and comprehensive.
home.whySwitchDescription1: Use EU-based digital alternatives that comply with GDPR, ensuring your data is processed with transparency and security.
home.whySwitchDescription2: Support the local tech ecosystem and contribute to a fairer digital economy.

gmailToProton.title: Gmail → ProtonMail
gmailToProton.description: Switch from Gmail to ProtonMail with our step-by-step migration guide.

driveToPcloud.title: Google Drive → Pcloud
driveToPcloud.description: Migrate your files from Google Drive to Pcloud with this complete guide.
driveToPcloud.alt: Google Drive to Pcloud migration guide

whatsappToSignal.title: WhatsApp → Signal
whatsappToSignal.description: Move your chats and contacts from WhatsApp to Signal with our comprehensive guide.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy | Switch-to.EU
privacy.description: Learn how Switch-to.EU collects, uses, and protects your personal data in accordance with GDPR and European privacy laws.

terms.title: Terms of Service | Switch-to.EU
terms.description: Read the terms of service for Switch-to.EU and our tools, including KeepFocus, Plotty, and Nully.

contribute.title: Contribute
contribute.description: Help us improve the database by adding new services or updating existing ones
contribute.ctaTitle: Missing a service? Let us know!
contribute.ctaDescription: Can't find the service you're looking for? Tell us which service you'd like to see and we might add it to our platform.
contribute.serviceRequestDescription: Help us expand our catalog by suggesting EU-based services that should be added to Switch-to.eu.
contribute.serviceRequestDescriptionLabel: Why should we add this service?
contribute.serviceRequestDescriptionPlaceholder: Tell us about this service, what it does, why it's a good EU alternative, and what non-EU service it could replace...
contribute.serviceRequestSuccessMessage: Thank you for your suggestion! We'll review it and consider adding this service.
contribute.serviceRequestErrorMessage: Something went wrong. Please try again.

validation.titleMinLength: Service name must be at least 5 characters.
validation.titleNoHtml: HTML tags are not allowed in the service name.
validation.descriptionMinLength: Description must be at least 10 characters.
validation.descriptionNoHtml: HTML tags are not allowed in the description.

meta.title: Contribute to Switch-to.EU | Help Build EU Alternatives
meta.description: Learn how to contribute to Switch-to.EU by adding migration guides, service alternatives, and helping grow our community-driven platform.

hero.title: Join the Switch-to.EU Community
hero.description: Your expertise can help Europeans reclaim their digital sovereignty! Switch-to.EU empowers users to migrate from big tech services to European alternatives, and we need your help to grow this movement.

migration.title: Share Your Migration Knowledge
migration.description: Do you have experience switching to EU-based services? Your insights could help countless others make the same journey. We need detailed, user-friendly migration guides.

tester.title: Be a Guide Tester
tester.description: Even if you haven't made the switch yet, you can help by testing our existing guides. Your fresh perspective helps identify confusing steps or missing information.

discover.title: Discover EU Alternatives
discover.description: Help us expand our catalog of European digital services. Research and document EU-based alternatives to popular international services.

technical.title: Lend Your Technical Skills
technical.description: Are you a developer? Our platform needs continuous improvement to serve our growing community. From fixing bugs to implementing new features.

ideas.title: Bring Your Ideas
ideas.description: Have suggestions for improving Switch-to.EU? Your insights can shape the future of our platform and help us better serve the European digital community.

translate.title: Help Us Translate
translate.description: We're always looking for native speakers to help us translate the website into other languages.

whyMatters.title: Why Your Contribution Matters
whyMatters.description: Every contribution, big or small, strengthens digital independence in Europe. By helping others make informed choices about their digital services, you're supporting privacy, data protection, and the European digital economy.

meta.title: Contributing to Switch-to.EU | Content Guide
meta.description: Learn how to contribute content to Switch-to.EU through GitHub by creating migration guides, adding service alternatives, and improving the platform.

hero.title: Contributing to Switch-to.EU Content
hero.description: A community-driven platform helping users switch from non-EU digital services to EU alternatives through clear, step-by-step migration guides.

repositoryOverview.title: Repository Overview
repositoryOverview.description: The switch-to-eu/content repository contains all the written content for our platform, organized as Markdown files. This includes migration guides, service descriptions, and other documentation.

whatYouCanContribute.title: What You Can Contribute
points: Migration guides for switching from non-EU to EU services
Documentation about EU service alternatives
Updates or corrections to existing content
Translations of existing content into other European languages

step1.title: 1. Fork the Content Repository
points: Go to https://github.com/switch-to-eu/content
Click the "Fork" button in the top right corner
This creates your personal copy of the content repository

step2.title: 2. Clone Your Fork (Optional)
step2.description: If you prefer to work locally:

step3.title: 3. Create or Edit Content
step3.optionA: Option A: Edit Directly on GitHub
optionAPoints: Navigate to the file you want to edit in your fork
Click the pencil icon to edit
Make your changes in the editor
optionBPoints: Create a branch: git checkout -b your-branch-name
Create or edit files using your preferred text editor

step4.title: 4. Follow Content Structure
step4.description: Our content is organized as follows:
points: /guides/ - Migration guides organized by service category
/alternatives/ - Information about EU service alternatives
/templates/ - Templates for creating new content

step5.title: 5. Submit a Pull Request
points: Navigate to your fork on GitHub
Click "Contribute" then "Open pull request"
Provide a clear title and description of your changes
Submit the pull request

formatting.title: Formatting
points: All content should be written in Markdown
Use headers (# ## ###) to organize content
Include a title and brief introduction at the top of each guide
Use screenshots where helpful (place in /images/ directory)

writingStyle.title: Writing Style
points: Use clear, straightforward language
Aim for step-by-step instructions where applicable
Be factual and neutral when comparing services
Focus on practical migration information
Use inclusive language

migrationGuidesStructure.title: Migration Guides Structure
points: An overview of the migration process
Prerequisites (accounts, tools needed)
Step-by-step migration instructions
Verification steps to ensure successful migration
Troubleshooting common issues (if applicable)

reviewProcess.title: Review Process
points: A maintainer will review your contribution
You may receive feedback requesting changes
Once approved, your content will be merged and published to the website

questionsAndSupport.title: Questions and Support
points: Comment on related issues for context
Ask questions in your pull request if you need clarification

callToAction.title: Make a Difference Today
callToAction.description: Thank you for helping Europeans take control of their digital lives through quality content contributions!

about.title: About Switch-to.eu
about.description: We help EU citizens find digital services governed by EU law
about.heroDescription1: Switch-to.EU is a community-driven platform that helps users easily switch from non-EU digital services to EU alternatives through clear, step-by-step migration guides.
about.heroDescription2: Our goal is to promote digital sovereignty and data privacy by making it easier for users to find and migrate to services hosted within the European Union.

initiative.heading: Moving away from big tech? We help you make the switch.
initiative.intro: Switch-to.eu is an initiative by Vincent and Simon Peters, digital designers from Antwerp who want to guide people in transitioning from American tech giants to European and open-source alternatives.

mission.title: Our mission
mission.description1: In a world where American tech giants are amassing increasing control over our data and digital lives, Switch-to.eu offers an escape route. We believe everyone should have access to user-friendly, privacy-respecting digital tools developed in Europe.
mission.description2: Growing concerns about data privacy and the increasing monopolistic power of American tech companies led us to create this platform. Especially after big tech's shameless capitulation to Donald Trump, interest in European alternatives has only grown.

whatWeDo.title: What we do
whatWeDo.description: Switch-to.eu offers step-by-step guides for replacing everyday digital tools like WhatsApp, Gmail, Chrome, and social media platforms with privacy-focused European alternatives. Our guides are specifically designed to be accessible to everyone - even your grandmother can make the switch with our simplified instructions.

uniqueness.title: What makes us unique
uniqueness.description1: Switch-to.eu fills an important gap in the digital world. There was no website that both clearly presents curated choices and consistently opts for European solutions that are actually practical to use.
points: Carefully selected European alternatives to popular American apps and services
Practical solutions that work in everyday life, not just complicated privacy tools for tech nerds
Simple, step-by-step guides that anyone can follow
A focus on both privacy and usability

callToAction.title: Start today
callToAction.description: Ready to take back control of your digital life? Explore our guides and discover how easy it can be to transition to a more privacy-respecting digital existence with European technology that simply works.

pillar1.title: European Alternatives
pillar1.description: We curate and maintain a comprehensive directory of EU-based digital services across various categories - from email providers and cloud storage to social media and productivity tools.

pillar2.title: Step-by-Step Guides
pillar2.description: We provide detailed, user-friendly migration guides that walk you through the process of moving your data and digital life from global services to European alternatives.

pillar3.title: Community Driven
pillar3.description: This platform is built by the community, for the community. All our guides and service listings are maintained through open collaboration, and we welcome contributions from anyone interested in promoting EU digital services.

about.whyChooseDescription: Choosing EU-based services offers several advantages that align with European values and regulations:

point1.title: Data Privacy & Protection
point1.description: EU-based digital services operate under the stringent General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), giving you greater control over your personal data. Your information is treated as your property, not a commodity to be sold or shared without your explicit consent.

point2.title: Ethical Business Practices
point2.description: European digital services often prioritize sustainable and ethical business models that don't rely heavily on surveillance capitalism. Instead of monetizing your attention and personal information, many EU alternatives focus on providing quality services through transparent subscription models.

point3.title: Digital Sovereignty
point3.description: Using EU-based services helps reduce dependence on big tech monopolies and supports a more diverse digital ecosystem. This contributes to technological independence for Europe and promotes innovation through healthy competition.

point4.title: Consumer Rights
point4.description: The EU has established some of the world's strongest consumer protection laws in the digital realm. When using EU-based services, you benefit from clear terms of service, transparent pricing, and robust mechanisms for dispute resolution if something goes wrong.

about.contributionDescription: Digital sovereignty isn't just about where your data is stored—it's about having genuine choice and control in your digital life. By switching to EU-based services, you're taking an important step toward a more balanced, user-respecting digital ecosystem.

point1.description: Share your migration knowledge by creating detailed, user-friendly guides.

point2.description: Test existing guides to help identify confusing steps or missing information.

point3.description: Research and document EU-based alternatives to popular international services.

point4.description: Contribute code, design, or translations to improve our platform.

dataSovereignty.title: Data Sovereignty
dataSovereignty.description: Your data stays within EU jurisdiction, under stronger privacy laws.

gdprCompliance.title: GDPR Compliance
gdprCompliance.description: EU services must comply with strict data protection requirements.

legalRecourse.title: Legal Recourse
legalRecourse.description: Easier legal remedies if something goes wrong with your data.

supportEUDigital.title: Support EU Digital Economy
supportEUDigital.description: Contribute to digital independence and innovation within Europe.

cta.title: Can't Find What You Need?
cta.description: We're constantly adding new guides. If you don't see the migration guide you're looking for, consider contributing to the project or reach out to suggest new guides.

editGuide.title: Found an issue or want to improve this guide?
editGuide.description: This guide is maintained by the community. If you found an error or have suggestions for improvement, please consider contributing.

tools.title: Tools
tools.description: Privacy-first tools built in Europe. No tracking, no accounts — just useful apps that respect your data.

dataSovereignty.title: Data Sovereignty
dataSovereignty.description: Ensure your data stays within EU jurisdiction and follows GDPR requirements

freeSimple.title: Free & Simple
freeSimple.description: All tools are free to use with intuitive interfaces and actionable results

euAlternatives.title: Open Source
euAlternatives.description: All our tools are open source and community-driven — inspect, contribute, and build with confidence

websiteTool.title: Website Tool
websiteTool.description: Analyze any website to check if it uses EU-based services and is GDPR compliant.

keepfocus.title: KeepFocus
keepfocus.description: A privacy-first Pomodoro timer and task manager that runs entirely in your browser.

plotty.title: Plotty
plotty.description: Create polls instantly — no registration, no email, no hassle. Simple scheduling that respects your privacy.

listy.title: Listy
listy.description: Create shared lists instantly — groceries, tasks, potluck. No account needed, end-to-end encrypted.

privnote.title: PrivNote
privnote.description: Send self-destructing private notes — end-to-end encrypted, no account needed.

quiz.title: Quiz
quiz.description: Run live quizzes for classrooms and teams — no registration, end-to-end encrypted, privacy-first.
